widget_utils¶

Functions¶

def close()

def delete()

def dock()

def float_()

def hide()

def isDocked()

def isFloating()

def raise_()

def show()

def undock()

Description¶

Utility functions relating to Maya widgets.

Terminology¶

The following terminology is adopted by this module and other modules within this package.

Term Description
Window A widget which which has the PySide2.QtCore.Qt.Window flag set.
Docked Widget A widget which which is parented to a cmds.workspaceControl().
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.close(widget)¶

Close a widget or its cmds.workspaceControl() if it is docked.

Note

An undocked widget will be deleted if it has the PySide2.QtCore.Qt.WA_DeleteOnClose attribute set. A docked widget will be deleted if the retain state of its cmds.workspaceControl() is disabled.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to close.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.delete(widget)¶

Delete a widget and close its cmds.workspaceControl() if it is docked.

Note

This function differs to close() in that it ensures the widget will always be deleted.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to close.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.dock(widget, dockName=None, retain=None, uiScript=None)¶

Dock a widget to a cmds.workspaceControl().

If the cmds.workspaceControl() already exists it will be restored (ie. expanded if collapsed, restored if minimized, shown if hidden). Otherwise a new cmds.workspaceControl() will be created.

If the dockName is None, the widget will be assigned a PySide2.QtCore.QObject.objectName() if it does not already have one.

Parameters:
  • widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to dock.
  • dockName (basestring) – Name of an existing cmds.workspaceControl() or name for the new cmds.workspaceControl(). Defaults to None - use the PySide2.QtCore.QObject.objectName() of widget to determine a name for the cmds.workspaceControl().
  • retain (bool) – Whether the cmds.workspaceControl() will be hidden instead of deleted when it is closed. Defaults to None - retain behaviour is based on the PySide2.QtCore.Qt.WA_DeleteOnClose attribute of the widget.
  • uiScript (basestring, optional) – Script to use when creating the cmds.workspaceControl(). Responsible for docking a new instance of the widget. Defaults to None - no script.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.float_(widget)¶

Display a widget as a window or float its cmds.workspaceControl() if it is docked.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to float.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.hide(widget)¶

Hide an undocked widget or the cmds.workspaceControl() of a docked widget.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to hide.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.isDocked(widget)¶

Return whether a widget is docked.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to query.
Returns:bool – True if widget is docked to a cmds.workspaceControl(), otherwise False.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.isFloating(widget)¶

Return whether a widget is floating.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to query.
Returns:bool – True if widget is a window or is docked to a cmds.workspaceControl() which is floating, otherwise False.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.raise_(widget)¶

Raise a widget to the top of its parent widget’s stack or raise its cmds.workspaceControl() if it is docked.

Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to raise.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.show(widget)¶

Show a widget or its cmds.workspaceControl().

  • If the widget is unparented, it will be parented to the Maya main window as a standalone window.
  • If the widget is undocked but parented, it will be restored if minimized, raised if covered and shown if hidden.
  • If the widget is docked, the cmds.workspaceControl() will be restored.
Parameters:widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to show.
msTools.coreUI.maya.widget_utils.undock(widget, closeWorkspaceControl=True)¶

Undock a widget from its cmds.workspaceControl() and parent it to the Maya main window as a standalone window.

Parameters:
  • widget (T <= PySide2.QtWidgets.QWidget) – The widget to undock.
  • closeWorkspaceControl (bool, optional) – Whether the cmds.workspaceControl() should be closed. Defaults to True.
